MessageHelpInfo.MessageHelp:
A request to the equipment to report selected values of its status.
The following structure is approved for all item formats and should be used by all new implementations:
L,n 1.<SVID1> . . n.<SVIDn>
* n = 0 : Request all SVIDs

The equipment reports the value of each SVID requested in the order requested. The host remembers the names of values requested.
L,n 1.<SV1> . . n.<SVn>

The purpose of this message is to provide a formal means of initializing communications at a logical application level both on power-up and following a break in communications. It should be the following any period where host and Equipment SECS applications are unable to communicate.
L,2 1.<MDLN> 2.<SOFTREV>
or
L,0

Accept or deny Establish Communications Request (S1,F13). MDLN and SOFTREV are on-line data and are valid only if COMMACK = 0.
L,2 1.<COMMACK> 2.L,2 1.<MDLN> 2.<SOFTREV>
or
L,2 1.<COMMACK> 2.L,0

Acknowledge or error
<ACKC6>

Constants such as for calibration, servo gain, alarm limits, data collection mode, and other values that are changed infrequently can be obtained using this message.
The following structure is approved for all item formats and should be used by all new implementations L,n 1.<ECID1> . . n.<ECIDn>
n=0 , Request all ECID

Data Response to S2,F13 in the order requested.
L,n 1.<ECV1> 2.<ECV2> . . n.<ECVn>

Change one or more equipment constants
L,n 1.L,2 1.<ECID1> 2.<ECV1> 2.L,2 1.<ECID2> 2.<ECV2> . . n. L,2 1.<ECIDn> 2.<ECVn>

Acknowledge or error If EAC contains a non-zero error code, the equipment should not change any of the ECIDs specified in S2F15.
<EAC>
Useful to check equipment time base or for equipment to synchronize with the host time base.

Status variables exist at all times. The trace data is returned on S6,F1 and is related to the original request by the TRID Multiple trace requests may be made to that equipment allowing it. If equipment receives S2,F23 with the same TRID as a trace function that is currently in progress, the equipment should terminate the old trace and then initiate the new trace. A trace function currently in progress may be terminated by S2,F23 with TRID of that trace and TOTSMP=0.
L,5 1. <TRID> 2. <DSPER> 3. <TOTSMP> 4. <REPGSZ> 5.L,n 1. <SVID1> . . n. <SVIDn>

Acknowledge or error
<TIAACK>

The purpose of this message is for the host to define a group of reports for the equipment. If S2,F33 is Multi-block, it must be preceded by the S2,F39/S2,F40 Inquire/Grant transaction.( not support multi block because HSMS )
L,2 1. <DATAID> 2. L,a # reports L,2 report 1 1. <RPTID1> 2. L,b 1. <SVID1> . . b.<SVIDb> L,2 report a 1. <RPTIDa> 2. L,c 1. <SVID1> . . c.<SVIDc>

Acknowledge or error If an error condition is detected the entire message is rejected (i.e., partial changes are not allowed).
<DRACK>

The purpose of this message is for the host to link n reports to an event (CEID). These linked event reports will default to “disabled” upon linking. That is, the occurrence of an event would not cause the report to be sent until enabled. See S2,F37 for enabling reports. If S2,F35 is Multi-block, it must be preceded by the S2,F39/S2,F40 Inquire/Grant transaction.( not support multi block because HSMS )
L,2 <DATAID> L,a 1. L,2 1. <CEID1> 2. L,b 1. <RPTID1> . . b. <RPTIDb> . . a. L,2 1. <CEIDc> 2. L,c 1. <RPTID1> . . k. <RPTIDc>

The purpose of this message is for the host to enable or disable reporting for a group of events (CEIDs).
L,2 1.<CEED> 2.L,n 1.<CEID1> . . n.<CEIDn>

Acknowledge or error If an error condition is detected the entire message is rejected.
<ERACK>

This Message Requests an action to be performed for a specified carrier
<ProceedWithCarrier for ID verification> L,6 1.<DATAID> 2.<CARRIERACTION> 3.<CARRIERSPEC> 4.<PTN> 5.<RETURNCAR> 6.L,n (A zero length list, n=0, requests the carrier ID only) 1.L,2 1.<CATTRID1> 2.L,m m = 25, or m=0 (when Foup is 1. L,2 1. <LOTID1> 2. <WAFERID1> m. L,2 1. <LOTIDn> 2. <WAFERIDn>
<ProceedWithCarrier for Slotmap Verification> L,5 1.<DATAID> 2.<CARRIERACTION> 3.<CARRIERSPEC> 4.<PTN> 5. L,0

This message acknowledges the carrier action request.
L,2 1.<CAACK> 2.L,n 1.L,2 1.<ERRCODE1> 2.<ERRTEXT1> ... n.L,2 1.<ERRCODEn> 2.<ERRTEXTn>

This function sends samples to the host according to the trace setup done by S2,F23. Trace is a time-driven form of equipment status. Even if S6,F1 is multi-block, it is not preceded by an Inquire/Grant transaction, because the Host S2,F23 is an implicit grant. Some equipment may support only single-block S6,F1, and may refuse an S2,F23 (Trace Initiate Send) message which would cause a multi-block S6,F1.
L,4 1.<TRID> 2.<SMPLN> 3.<STIME> 4.L,n 1.<SV1> 2.<SV2> . . n.<SVn>

Acknowledge or error
<ACKC6>

The purpose of this message is for the equipment to send a defined, linked, and enabled group of reports to the host upon the occurrence of an event (CEID). If S6,F11 is Multi-block, it must be preceded by the S6,F5/S6,F6Inquire/Grant transaction
L,3 1.<DATAID> 2.<CEID> 3.L,a 1.L,2 <RPTID1> 1.L,b 1.<V1> . . b.<Vb> . . a.L,2 <RPTIDa> 2. L,c <V1> . . c.<Vc>

This message is used by either equipment or host to request a particular process program from the other.
<PPID>

This message transfers a process program in response to a request for the PPID. The values of MDLN and SOFTREV are obtained from the PCD used to generate the process program.
L,4 1.<PPID> 2.<MDLN> 3.<SOFTREV> 4.L,c (c=Number of Process Commands) 1.L,2 1.<CCODE> 2.L,p (p=Number of Parameters) <PPARM1> . . <PPARMp> 2.L,2 1.<CCODE> 2.L,p (p=Number of Parameters) <PPARM1> . . <PPARMp> . . c.L,2 <CCODE> L,p (p=Number of Parameters) <PPARM1> . . <PPARMp>

Data to be displayed on the equipment’s terminal
L,2 1.<TID> L,n 1.<TEXT1> . . n.<TEXTn>

Acknowledge or error
<ACKC10>

Create Object Request (COR) This message is used to request an object owner to create an object instance.
L,3 1. <OBJSPEC> 2. <OBJTYPE> 3. L,a a = # attributes requested 1. L,2 1. <ATTRID1> 2. <ATTRDATA1> . . a. L,2 1. <ATTRIDa> 2. <ATTRDATAa>

Create Object Acknowledge (CAO)
This message is used to acknowledge the success or failure of creating the new object specified.
L,3 1. <OBJSPEC> 2. L,b b = number of attributes returned 1. L,2 1. <ATTRID1> 2. <ATTRDATA1> . . b. L,2 1. <ATTRIDb> 2. <ATTRDATAb> 3. L,2 1. <OBJACK> 2. L,p p = number of errors reported 1. L,2 1. <ERRCODE1> 2. <ERRTEXT1> . . p. L,2 1. <ERRCODEp> 2. <ERRTEXTp>

Module Job Request
This message is not specified in SEMI specification. The message is special message that is user defined for EIL. The message is used to request an object owner to create a Module Job.
L,3 1. <MODULEID> 2. <MODULEJOBID> 3. L,n 1.L,2 1. <SEQUENCENO1> 2. L,m 1.L,2 1. <EQPID1> 2. <CONTROLJOBID1> . . . m.L,2 1. <EQPIDm> 2. <CONTROLJOBIDm>
n. L,2 1. <SEQUENCENOn> 2. L,m 1.L,2 1. <EQPID1> 2. <CONTROLJOBID1> . . . m.L,2 1. <EQPIDm> 2. <CONTROLJOBIDm>

Module Job Request Acknowledge
L,2 1. <MJACK> 2. L,n 1.L,2 1. <ERRTEXT1> 2. <ERRCODE1> . . . n. L,2 1. <ERRCODEn> 2. <ERRCODEn>

PRJobMultiCreate
Use this single message to Create Multiple Process Jobs, each of which may be unique in its association of material to process recipe. If multi-block, this message must be preceded by the S16,F1/F2 tansaction. Specially, We add <CHAMBERPATH> attribute unlike SEMI Specification
L,2 1.<DATAID> 2.L,p [p=# of process jobs being created] 1.L,6 1.<PRJOBID1> 2.<MF1> 3a.L,n [MF=carrier, n=# of carriers] 1.L,2 1.<CARRIERID1> 2.L,j [j=# of slots, may be implemented as an array.] 1.<SLOTID1> 2.<SLOTID2> . . . j.<SLOTIDj> . . . n.L,2 1.<CARRIERIDn> 2.L,j [j=# of slots, may be implemented as an array.] 1.<SLOTID1> 2.<SLOTID2> . . . j.<SLOTIDj> 3b.L,n [MF=carrier, n=# of carriers] 1.<MID1> . . . n.<MIDn> 4.L,4 1.<PRRECIPEMETHOD1> 2.<RCPSPEC1> 3.<CHMBERPATH1> 4.L,m [m=# recipe parameters] 1.L,2 1.<RCPPARNM1> 2.<RCPPARVAL1> . . . m.L,2 1.<RCPPARNMm> 2.<RCPPARVALm> 5.<PRPROCESSSTART1> 6.<PRPAUSEEVENT1> p.L,6 1.<PRJOBIDp> 2.<MFp> 3a.L,n [MF=carrier, n=# of carriers] 1.L,2 1.<CARRIERID1> 2.L,j [j=# of slots, may be implemented as an array.] 1.<SLOTID1> 2.<SLOTID2> . . . j.<SLOTIDj> . . . n.L,2 1.<CARRIERIDn> 2.L,j [j=# of slots, may be implemented as an array.] 1.<SLOTID1> 2.<SLOTID2> . . . j.<SLOTIDj> 3b.L,n [MF=carrier, n=# of carriers] 1.<MID1> . . . n.<MIDn> 4.L,4 1.<PRRECIPEMETHODp> 2.<RCPSPECp> 3.<CHMBERPATHp> 4.L,m [m=# recipe parameters] 1.L,2 1.<RCPPARNM1> 2.<RCPPARVAL1> . . . m.L,2 1.<RCPPARNMm> 2.<RCPPARVALm> 5.<PRPROCESSSTARTp> 6.<PRPAUSEEVENTp>

PRJobMultiCreate Acknowledge
This message acknowledges the request and reports any errors in the creation of a process job. ERRTEXT contains the identifier of process jobs that were not created.
L,2 1.L,m [m=# jobs created] 1.<PRJOBID1> . . . m.<PRJOBIDm> 2.L,2 1.<ACKA> 2.L,n 1.L,2 1.<ERRCODE1> 2.<ERRTEXT1> . . . n.L,2 1.<ERRCODEn> 2.<ERRTEXTn>
